questions.question: What was one significant impact of the opening of the Panama Canal?

choices.answer: Helped reduce the spread of communism in Latin America
It increased trade by reducing travel times between oceans
Resulted in the signing of the Treaty of Versailles
Created tension between the US & Latin American countries over immigration

questions.question: Why did the US Senate refuse to ratify the Treaty of Versailles after WWI?

choices.answer: Senate believed the treaty did not punish Germany enough
Senate thought the treaty did not have power to stop alliances
Senate could not agree on military disarmament levels
Senate did not support America's participation in League of Nations

questions.question: What message about imperialism did this political cartoon convey?

choices.answer: The closer a territory is the more self-government it should allow
It was not worth angering European powers to annex new territories
Farther imperialist expansion extends the harder it will be to maintain
Imperialism was not likely to improve access to overseas markets

questions.question: What was the purpose of the Pure Food and Drug Act of 1906?

choices.answer: To reduce production costs for food and drug manufacturing
To prevent shortages by regulating the supply of food and drugs
To lower the cost of essential foods and drugs for consumers
To protect consumers by regulating the food and drug industry

questions.question: Which example best defines a historical era?

choices.answer: A piece of landmark legislation passed during congressional session
A collection of art by a world-renowned artist
A genre of music specific to a region of a country
A period characterized by certain political, social, or economic events

questions.question: What was the primary reason for these masks during World War I?

choices.answer: To hide the identities of soldiers from approaching enemies
To protect soldiers from spreading contagious diseases
To protect soldiers from the effects of poison gas
To help soldiers use night vision technology to find the enemy

questions.question: The United States found it difficult to remain neutral during World War I because its desire to

choices.answer: Expand its interests in the Caribbean
Control the Suez Canal
Maintain freedom of the seas for trade with European Nations
Obtain migrant workers for American mines and factories

questions.question: What was one economic effect of the Spanish-American War?

choices.answer: Shipbuilding industries in the U.S. declined
New free and fair trade treaties were established between countries
The U.S. gained direct access to additional natural resources and markets
Demand for coal and petroleum as energy sources declined

questions.question: Which source of information is a primary source about trench warfare during World War I

choices.answer: A later novel about World War I
A textbook map showing World War I battlefields
A diary kept by a solder fighting on the front during WWI
An encyclopedia article about World War I

questions.question: In the late 1800s, Sanford B. Dole contributed to the expansion of the U.S. by advocating annexation of?

choices.answer: Puerto Rico
Philippines
Panama Canal
Hawaii

questions.question: How did the Nineteenth Amendment expand the democratic process?

choices.answer: Prohibiting discrimination in voting on the basis of gender
By prohibiting those eighteen or younger to vote
By prohibiting discrimination in voting on the basis of race
By eliminating the poll tax

questions.question: What was one effect of the arrival of the American Expeditionary Forces in Europe during WWI?

choices.answer: Italy left the Central powers alliance
The Allies were able to launch a major counterattack on the western front
Russian forces were able to withdraw from the eastern front
The heir to the Austro-Hungarian throne was assassinated

questions.question: How did the decision in Schenck v. U.S. affect the rights of U.S. Citizens?

choices.answer: By placing limits on freedom of expression
By establishing restrictions on the right to vote
By protecting the freedoms of religious minorities
By protecting the freedoms of religious minorities

questions.question: Why did Senator Henry Cabot Lodge advocate for the denial of Wilson's Fourteenth Point?

choices.answer: A relaxation of U.S. citizenship requirements was warranted
U.S. entry into the Spanish-American War was unjust
U.S. membership in the League of Nations would tangle the U.S. with Europe
Industrial nations should have equal access to colonies

questions.question: This cartoon comments on tactics used to?

choices.answer: Secure the southern border of California
Protect shipping lanes in the Great Lakes
Create a defensive alliance with France
Obtain control of the Panama Canal Zone

questions.question: This cartoon depicts President Woodrow Wilson calling on Congress to?

choices.answer: Issue a declaration of war against Germany
Enact trade sanctions against Germany
Ratify the Treaty of Versaills
Authorize the use of funds to support Russian revolutionaries

questions.question: Wilson's Fourteen Points supported Poland by calling for its?

choices.answer: Inclusion in one of the larger empires
Establishment as an independent nation
Establishment as a Soviet satellite nation
Annexation by Great Britain

questions.question: Germany was forced to give up territory and pay reparations to ensure Germany...

choices.answer: Created a democratic government
Was divided into smaller states to be governed by Allied countries
Granted independence to all German colonies
Has weakened power in the international community

questions.question: During WWI, tanks were used on the western front primarily to

choices.answer: Lead infantry advances across no mans land and into enemy territory
Release chemical weapons in advance attacks on enemy positions
Destroy railroads and bridges used by enemy troops
Launch long-range rockets at enemy aircraft

questions.question: How did the U.S. acquire Puerto Rico?

choices.answer: Signed an annexation treaty after the over through of its Queen
Was promised U.S. military protection as part of Wilsons 14pts.
Was ceded to the US as a result of the Span.-Amer. War
Became a U.S. state during the Reconstruction Era

questions.question: The Spanish-American War marked a turning point in American foreign policy because the U.S. ...

choices.answer: They prompted the end of Dollar Diplomacy
Helped establish the U.S. as an imperial power similar to European nations
They set a precedent of including territorial acquisitions in settlements
They increased public support for cuts in U.S. defense spending

questions.question: Why did the United States decide to enter WWI?

choices.answer: A European nation had taken aggressive actinos against the U.S.
The U.S. president was obligated to fulfill election campaign promises
U.S. had suffered economically from European sanctions
Communist activities among U.S. immigrants were threatening the country

questions.question: The Fourteen Points reflected President Woodrow Wilson's belief that?

choices.answer: No country should be allowed to spend more on defense then the other
Intervention in affairs of other nations was never justifiable
Travel among nations should be regulated by an international organization
Cooperation among international leaders was essential to maintaining peace

questions.question: The primary objective of the Dawes Act was to?

choices.answer: End warfare between American Indians and U.S. military
Turn American reservations into corporate farmland
Promote cultural assimilation of American Indians
Promote American Indian investment in private industry

questions.question: How did we acquire the Hawaiian Islands?

choices.answer: Forced annexation of the islands after the overthrow of the monarcy
Colonization of the islands by political refugees from the U.S.
Classification of the islands as a protectorate
Granting of U.S. statehood to the islands after they were purchased

questions.question: Why did President Roosevelt issue the Roosevelt Corollary?

choices.answer: Claim the right to construct the Panama Canal
The threat of European intervention in Latin America
Ward off Spanish efforts to suppress a rebellion in Cuba
Public outcry regarding war between Russia and Japan

questions.question: Upon entering WWI, the U.S. enlarged its military by

choices.answer: Creating the Veterans Administration
Establishing the Marine Corps
Enacting the GI Bill
Passing the Selective Service Act

questions.question: This WWI era poster was intended to persuade

choices.answer: Farmers to consume fewer scarce goods during the war
Women to work producing war materials
People to help finance the war
People to save money during the war
